item.title: Notes on Apache Zookeeper Security
item.description: == Authentication .Examples https://github.com/jeqo/docker-composes/tree/master/zookeeper-security === Client/Server Authentication ==== SASL Authentication SASL Authentication alone does not deny access to anonymous users. Beware of this as it gives a false sense of security, and can take some time to realize. Reference: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZOOKEEPER-1736 This can be solved by forcing an Authentication Scheme: requireClientAuthScheme=sasl .Futher reading https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/ZOOKEEPER/Client-Server+mutual+authentication === Server/Server Authentication .Futher reading https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/ZOOKEEPER/Server-Server+mutual+authentication == Authorization
